text:
Svidrigaïlov walked out of the garden, troubled. 

The evening was dark and stifling. 

Thunder rumbled as rain poured down. 

He returned home, drenched. 

He locked himself in and tore up papers. 

He pocketed his money and left without locking the door. 

He went straight to Sonia. 

She was with the Kapernaumov children, giving them tea. 

The children fled in terror at his appearance. 

He sat at the table, inviting Sonia to join him. 

“I may be going to America,” he said. 

“I’ve come to make some arrangements.” 

Sonia listened, her eyes wide with wonder.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Svidrigaïlov visits Sonia to discuss his potential departure to America and make arrangements, while a storm rages outside.
